item.title: 对前世界重量级拳击冠军乔治-福尔曼去世的反应
item.description: 美国奥运冠军、两届重量级拳击冠军乔治-福尔曼于周五在得克萨斯州休斯敦去世，享年76岁。【原文：Following are quotes and reaction to the death of American Olympic champion and twice heavyweight boxing champion George Foreman, who died on Friday at age 76 in Houston, Texas.】

item.title: 唐纳德-特朗普和约翰-罗伯茨：两大巨头与压力下的美国司法机构
item.description: 对于美国最有权势的两个人唐纳德-特朗普和约翰-罗伯茨来说，这从一开始就是一场微妙的舞蹈。【原文：For two of the most powerful men in the United States, Donald Trump and John Roberts, it has been a delicate dance from the start.】

item.title: 独家报道数以千计的特工被调往特朗普的移民镇压行动
item.description: 通常追捕虐待儿童者的联邦特工现在正在打击非法居住在美国的移民。【原文：Federal agents who usually hunt down child abusers are now cracking down on immigrants who live in the U.S. illegally.】

item.title: 特朗普签署旨在防止滥用法律制度和联邦法院的备忘录
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周五签署了一份备忘录，白宫称该备忘录旨在防止滥用法律制度和联邦法院。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump signed a memorandum on Friday that the White House said aimed at preventing abuses of legal system and the federal courts.】

item.title: 贸易紧张局势下，亲特朗普参议员会见中国经济部长
item.description: 美国参议员史蒂夫-戴恩斯（Steve Daines）是唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统的坚定支持者，他于周六会见了中国经济沙皇、国务院副总理何立峰，这是特朗普重返白宫后美国政治家首次访问北京。【原文：U.S. Senator Steve Daines, a strong supporter of President Donald Trump, met with China’s economy tsar, Vice Premier He Lifeng, on Saturday, marking the first visit by a U.S. politician to Beijing since Trump returned to the White House.】

item.title: CBS 分公司称新墨西哥州发生多起枪击案
item.description: 美国哥伦比亚广播公司（CBS）的一家新闻机构周六援引警察局的消息称，新墨西哥州拉斯克鲁塞斯发生多起枪击案。【原文：Multiple gunshot victims were reported in Las Cruces, New Mexico, a CBS News affiliate said on Saturday, citing the police department.】

item.title: 特朗普撤销卡马拉-哈里斯和希拉里-克林顿的安全许可
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周五取消了前副总统卡马拉-哈里斯、前国务卿希拉里-克林顿等人的安全许可，这是他针对民主党对手采取的最新举措。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday took away security clearances for former Vice President Kamala Harris, former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton and others in his latest move against his Democratic opponents.】

item.title: 重量级拳王、烧烤传播者乔治-福尔曼（George Foreman）逝世，享年 76 岁
item.description: 美国人乔治-福尔曼（George Foreman）是体育界最伟大的 "第二幕 "之一，他在 45 岁时夺回了重量级拳击冠军头衔，并成为著名的产品推销员，他于周五去世，享年 76 岁。【原文：American George Foreman, one of the great second acts in sports, who reclaimed the heavyweight boxing title at age 45 and became a celebrated product pitchman, died on Friday at age 76.】

item.title: 美国之音员工就美资新闻机构被关闭一事起诉特朗普政府
item.description: 美国之音 "的员工、记者和工会周五在纽约起诉特朗普政府，称关闭美国资助的新闻机构侵犯了员工的新闻自由第一修正案权利。【原文：Voice of America employees, journalists and unions sued the Trump administration in New York on Friday, saying that the shutdown of U.S.-funded news agencies violated the workers' First Amendment right to journalistic freedom.】

item.title: 美国之音员工就美资新闻机构被关闭一事起诉特朗普政府
item.description: 美国之音 "的员工、记者和工会周五在纽约起诉特朗普政府，称关闭美国资助的新闻机构侵犯了员工的新闻自由第一修正案权利。【原文：Voice of America employees, journalists and unions sued the Trump administration in New York on Friday, saying that the shutdown of U.S.-funded news agencies violated the workers' First Amendment right to journalistic freedom.】

item.title: 美国移民官员要求亲巴勒斯坦的康奈尔大学学生自首
item.description: Momodou Taal 的律师称这是对言论自由的侵犯。【原文：Momodou Taal's attorneys called the development a free speech assault.】

item.title: 美国国土部在政府裁员中将监督作为目标
item.description: 特朗普政府的一名官员和两名前官员说，美国国土安全部周五裁撤了三个监督办公室，让 100 多名工作人员带薪休假，在唐纳德-特朗普总统加大移民打击力度之际将他们排挤出局。【原文：The U.S. Department of Homeland Security on Friday gutted three oversight offices by placing more than 100 workers on paid leave, a Trump administration official and two former officials said, sidelining them as President Donald Trump amps up his immigration crackdown.】

item.title: 美国交通部长将公布空中交通管制升级计划
item.description: 美国运输部长肖恩-达菲（Sean Duffy）周五表示，他将于下周公布一项计划，对老化、人员不足的美国空中交通管制系统进行升级。【原文：Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy will unveil a plan next week to upgrade the aging, under-staffed U.S. air traffic control system next week, he said on Friday.】

item.title: 美国空军有哪些战斗机项目？
item.description: 波音公司击败了洛克希德-马丁公司，获得了制造美国空军迄今为止最先进的战斗机（F-47）的合同，该项目价值超过 200 亿美元。【原文：Boeing has been awarded the contract to build the U.S. Air Force's most sophisticated fighter jet yet, dubbed the F-47, beating out competition from Lockheed Martin for a program worth more than $20 billion.】

item.title: 官员称美国司法部将调查委内瑞拉黑帮情报泄露事件
item.description: 一名高级官员周五表示，美国司法部正在调查美国情报机构收集的有关委内瑞拉黑帮 Tren de Aragua 的所谓机密信息的泄露事件。【原文：The U.S. Justice Department is investigating a leak of what it called classified information collected by U.S. intelligence agencies about the Venezuelan gang Tren de Aragua, a senior official said on Friday.】

item.title: 美国参议员推动为加州火灾恢复提供更多资金
item.description: 周五，两位美国民主党参议员在一场毁灭性大火发生近三个月后，参观了阿尔塔迪纳被烧焦的废墟，并为重建加州社区争取更多资金。【原文：Two Democratic U.S. senators on Friday visited the charred ruins of Altadena nearly three months after a devastating fire and made a case for more funding to rebuild the California community.】

item.title: 特朗普取消 53 万古巴人、海地人、尼加拉瓜人和委内瑞拉人的合法身份
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的政府将取消53万古巴人、海地人、尼加拉瓜人和委内瑞拉人在美国的临时合法身份。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump's administration will revoke the temporary legal status of 530,000 Cubans, Haitians, Nicaraguans and Venezuelans in the United States, according to a Federal Register notice on Friday, the latest expansion of his crackdown on immigration.】

item.title: 美国法官阻止特朗普政府驱逐移民活动人士
item.description: 一名美国法官周五暂时禁止特朗普政府驱逐一名移民活动人士，这名活动人士本周在科罗拉多州被拘留，激怒了该州民主党人和移民权利倡导者。【原文：A U.S. judge on Friday temporarily barred the Trump administration from deporting an immigration activist whose detention in Colorado this week outraged state Democrats and immigration rights advocates.】

item.title: 美国法院不会暂停要求特朗普政府恢复 2.5 万名工人工作的裁决
item.description: 美国一家上诉法院周五拒绝暂停一项法官的裁决，该裁决要求唐纳德-特朗普总统的政府恢复 18 个联邦机构 25,000 名工人的工作，这些工人在特朗普对联邦工作人员的大清洗中失去了工作。【原文：A U.S. appeals court on Friday refused to pause a judge's ruling requiring the administration of President Donald Trump to reinstate 25,000 workers at 18 federal agencies who lost their jobs as part of Trump's purge of the federal workforce.】

item.title: 特朗普政府寻求取消律师事务所案法官的资格
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统的政府周五要求负责监督针对律师事务所帕金斯-科伊（Perkins Coie）的特朗普行政命令挑战案的联邦法官让位，称她的公正性 "可能会受到合理质疑"。【原文：President Donald Trump's administration on Friday asked the federal judge overseeing a challenge to Trump's executive order targeting law firm Perkins Coie to step aside from the case, saying her impartiality "might reasonably be questioned."】

item.title: 特朗普计划整顿监管，美国证券交易委员会举行加密货币工作组圆桌会议
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会加密货币工作组周五与专家们举行了首次公开会议，重点讨论了在特朗普政府寻求全面修订加密货币法规之际，证券法可能如何适用于数字资产。【原文：The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's crypto task force held its first public meeting with experts on Friday, focusing on how securities laws might apply to digital assets as the Trump administration looks to overhaul cryptocurrency regulations.】

item.title: 消息人士称，随着数百人接受特朗普的收购提议，美国证券交易委员会将出现人员外流现象
item.description: 五位熟知内情的人士告诉路透社，在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统和埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）努力重塑美国政府的背景下，数百名员工已同意接受辞职，华尔街的最高监管机构正面临关键部门人员外流的问题。【原文：Wall Street's top regulator is facing an exodus of staff across key departments as hundreds of employees have agreed to take resignation offers amid President Donald Trump and Elon Musk's efforts to remake the U.S. government, five people familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 致命碰撞事故发生后，美国议员敦促削减华盛顿地区的军事训练航班
item.description: 在今年 1 月一架美国航空公司支线飞机与一架美国陆军直升机在空中相撞造成 67 人死亡之后，十名美国众议院民主党议员周五敦促五角大楼减少在华盛顿特区的军事训练飞行。【原文：Ten U.S. House of Representatives Democratic lawmakers on Friday urged the Pentagon to reduce military training flights in the Washington, D.C., area after a January midair collision between an American Airlines regional jet and a U.S. Army helicopter killed 67 people.】

item.title: 加密货币公司创始人在美国承认操纵市场计划罪
item.description: 一家加密货币金融服务公司的创始人周五承认了美国对他的指控，即他参与了一个大范围的计划，代表客户公司操纵数字代币市场。【原文：The founder of a cryptocurrency financial services firm pleaded guilty on Friday to U.S. charges that he participated in a wide-ranging scheme to manipulate the market for digital tokens on behalf of client companies.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚大学的研究因特朗普削减经费而立即受到冲击
item.description: 哥伦比亚大学本月突然被关闭了数百万美元的联邦拨款，这已经扰乱了该校的医学和科学研究，因为该校将在周五的最后期限前屈服于政府的要求，对如何处理校园内的异议进行全面改革。【原文：The sudden shutdown of millions of dollars in federal funding to Columbia University this month is already disrupting medical and scientific research at the school as it confronts a Friday deadline to bow to government demands for sweeping changes in how it deals with dissent on campus.】

item.title: 特朗普与保罗-韦斯律师事务所的交易引发律师界恐慌
item.description: 华尔街强大的律师事务所保罗-魏斯（Paul Weiss）周五因与白宫达成交易以逃避危及该事务所业务的行政命令而遭到猛烈抨击，尽管一些律师表示该事务所几乎没有其他选择。【原文：Powerful Wall Street law firm Paul Weiss faced heavy criticism on Friday over a deal it struck with the White House to escape an executive order imperiling the firm's business, even as some lawyers said the firm faced few other options.】

item.title: 美国发布变性人禁军令指南，寻求取消法院命令
item.description: 美国国防部周五发布了关于如何执行唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统关于军队中变性人禁令的新指南，并要求联邦法官取消她最近下达的阻止该禁令的命令。【原文：The U.S. Department of Defense on Friday released new guidance on how it will enforce President Donald Trump's ban on transgender people in the military, and asked a federal judge to lift her recent order blocking the ban.】

item.title: 美国司法部采取行动保护特朗普免受 1 月 6 日诉讼的影响
item.description: 美国司法部已采取行动，保护唐纳德-特朗普总统免受警方和民主党议员的民事诉讼，这些诉讼要求特朗普总统对其支持者于 2021 年 1 月 6 日袭击美国国会大厦期间发生的暴力事件负责。【原文：The U.S. Justice Department has moved to shield President Donald Trump from civil lawsuits by police and Democratic lawmakers seeking to hold him responsible for violence during the January 6, 2021, attack on the U.S. Capitol by his supporters.】

item.title: 美国上诉法院驳回特朗普切断教师备课补助资金的请求
item.description: 在联邦上诉法院周五拒绝允许唐纳德-特朗普总统的政府取消对八个民主党领导的州的教师准备项目的拨款后，美国教育部必须继续为这些项目提供资金支持。【原文：The U.S. Department of Education must continue funding grants supporting teacher preparation programs in eight Democratic-led states after a federal appeals court on Friday declined to allow President Donald Trump's administration to cancel them.】

item.title: 美国上诉法院驳回特朗普切断教师备课补助资金的请求
item.description: 在联邦上诉法院周五拒绝允许唐纳德-特朗普总统的政府取消对八个民主党领导的州的教师准备项目的拨款后，美国教育部必须继续为这些项目提供资金支持。【原文：The U.S. Department of Education must continue funding grants supporting teacher preparation programs in eight Democratic-led states after a federal appeals court on Friday declined to allow President Donald Trump's administration to cancel them.】
